context.introduction: Welcome to the foundations of Mexican cuisine! Discover the essential ingredients and chiles that define the vibrant flavors of Mexico.

sections.title: Salsas: The Heart of Mexican Cooking
sections.content: Salsas are the soul of Mexican food. Most are made with tomatoes (jitomate or tomatillo), chiles, onions, garlic, and herbs. Each region has its own salsa traditions, and every family has a favorite recipe.

sections.title: Poblano Chile: The Gentle Giant
sections.content: The poblano chile is mild and perfect for beginners. When dried, it becomes the ancho chile, used in moles and sauces. Fresh poblanos are great for chiles rellenos and rajas.

sections.title: Corn Masa: Ancient Grain
sections.content: Corn masa is made through nixtamalization, an ancient process that improves flavor and nutrition. Fresh masa is used for tortillas, tamales, and many street foods.
